questions.text: According to the foreman in the song 'At the End of the Day,' what doesn't buy any bread?
questions.explanation:
Sitting flat on your butt.

	One of my favorite songs.

questions.text: Which two women are in love with Marius?
questions.explanation:
Eponine and Cosette.

	I don't think I could see Madame Thenardier embracing Marius. :)

questions.text: What will make the flowers grow?
questions.explanation:
A little fall of rain.

	Marius and Eponine sing 'A Little Fall of Rain' before she dies.

questions.text: Who is the leader of the rebels?
questions.explanation:
Enjolras.

	Enjolras is my favorite character.

questions.text: What will water the meadows of France?
questions.explanation:
The blood of the martyrs.

	The line, 'The blood of the martyrs will water the meadows of France' is from the song 'Do You Hear the People Sing,' my favorite song.

questions.text: True or False: Valjean dies peacefully.
questions.explanation:
True.

	As he dies the chorus sings the wonderful finale.

questions.text: According to Gavroche, what is tough on the teeth?
questions.explanation:
Crumbs of humble piety.

	From the song 'Look Down.'

Victor Hugo & Hugo.

	He also wrote 'The Hunchback of Notre Dame.'

questions.text: What number did Valjean have while in prison?
With whom did Fantine take Cosette to live?
questions.explanation:
The Thenardiers.

	They treated her very badly.

questions.text: What name does Valjean take on when he becomes the mayor?
questions.explanation:
Madeleine.

	"Madeleine" is his false surname, in the book and in the musical.

questions.text: In the song 'Red and Black,' who sings, 'I am agog! I am aghast! Is Marius in love at last?'?
questions.explanation:
Grantaire.

	'I've never seen him oooooooh and aaaaaaah!'

questions.text: What does Javert swear he will capture Valjean by?
Who is not a rebel student?
questions.explanation:
Javert.

	Javert is a police inspector.

questions.text: How long did it take the author to write the book 'Les Miserables'?
questions.explanation:
About 20 years.

	It takes about as long to read it! (My version is 1463 pages long.)
